name: Farmer Carry (Dumbbells or Ruck)
setup: Stand tall with a weight in each hand at your sides
Set ribs stacked over pelvis; pack shoulders down/back
steps: Brace lightly and begin walking with short, controlled steps
Keep torso tall and avoid leaning or swaying
Turn carefully; maintain control of weights
Set weights down safely by hinging hips when ending a set
cues: Grow tall; zipper ribs to hips
Crush the handles but keep elbows soft
mistakes: Leaning to one side or overextending lower back
Dropping weights without a safe hinge
safety: Choose a load that preserves posture and breathing. Use a hinge to pick up and set down the weights to protect your back.

regressions: Static suitcase hold (one side) or double DB hold
progressions: Uneven or suitcase carry for anti-lateral flexion

prescriptionHints.load: DBs 20–70 lb each depending on intent
prescriptionHints.distance: 40–100 m or shuttle in small space
prescriptionHints.notes: Timed + weighted. Prioritize posture; stop before grip fails.

joints.notes: Keep ribs stacked and avoid side-bending; hinge to pick/park weights.
